data.title: Olympic Percussion: Find the Right Instrument For You
data.meta_description: We break down all the percussion that Olympic have to offer. From durability to sound quality, let's look at how each instrument delivers.
data.text:
Olympic Marching Percussion

Olympic Marching Percussion is the perfect place for beginners and full bands alike. Each drum comes complete with a carrier and a pair of sticks/beaters, allowing you to begin playing straight away. They’re also fitted with a durable wrap finish in either black or white with satin hardware and a matching carrier.

Perfect for a range of different playing scenarios, you can choose an individual drum or a selection of drums for your band.

There are also marching bells, lyras, and maces to complete the ensemble.

Traditional

The traditional drums in this range reflect military-style music.

In the UK, scouts, training corps, boys and girls brigade, army cadet forces, and many other groups operate traditional marching bands which perform in parades.

Traditionally, a marching setup includes a range of marching snare drums played in unison, with either a bottom snare or a top and bottom snare combination.

They also include a range of tenor drums of different sizes and a single bass drum to maintain a strict marching tempo for the band.

Olympic traditional bass drums range from a small 14’’ x 10’’ to a powerful 28’’ x 12’’.

These bass drums are designed with student marching drummers in mind, providing a reliable instrument with great value for money.

Traditional marching snare drums are also a reliable instrument with great value for money. Crafted from basswood, these drums deliver a rich and resonant sound that carries well in outdoor settings.

The smooth white, 1-ply batter head ensures excellent responsiveness and projection, allowing you to create powerful and precise beats.

Equipped with satin powder-coated hardware, the Olympic Marching Snare Drum not only looks stylish but also ensures long-lasting durability.

The 1.5mm triple-flanged hoops offer reliable tuning and a great rimshot sound, enhancing the drum’s sound projection and articulation, whilst the satin powder-coated finish on the hoops adds a touch of elegance.

Additionally, the snare drum features a convenient throw-off mechanism for quick and effortless snare engagement adjustments.

Olympic also offer a top and bottom snare for added power.

Crafted with a shell size of 14″ x 12″ made from basswood, this drum provides a dominating snare tone that carries beautifully during any marching performance.

The traditional marching tenor drums are a versatile addition to any marching band or percussion ensemble.

They’re constructed from high-quality basswood and provide a clear and concise sound.

And to ensure they look as good as they sound, the shell features a smooth white PVC wrap, providing a smart and stylish aesthetic.

When it comes to fittings, the Olympic Marching Tenor Drums are equipped with separate satin hardware. This allows for easy adjustments and customisation to suit your individual preferences.

Additionally, the set features 1.5mm triple-flange steel hoops, offering optimal durability, tuning stability, and reliability.

Drum Corps

Drum corps and show bands are musical marching units which not only include drums but also brass and other percussion instruments. They originated in the United States and Canada but are now used in Europe and Asia, too.

Olympic drum corps bass drums and snare drums offer exceptional value for money and are a great choice for those wanting to begin their marching drumming journey.

They feature a basswood shell and 1.5mm triple-flanged hoops to provide a great tone with a reliable level of tuning stability.

Olympic multi-tenor sets are also a great and affordable way to add a range of timbres to your marching drumming setup.

High Tension

The high-tension drums of the Olympic range are designed with performing marching drummers in mind, giving them a sturdy and great sounding instrument. Their free-floating construction prevents unwanted sounds by eliminating the metal to wood contact on the shell of the snare.

This marching snare drum includes snare wires underneath the top head, as well as the bottom head. This provides a much more prominent snare tone – perfect for marching drummers.

The smooth white, 1-ply batter head ensures excellent responsiveness and projection, allowing you to create powerful and precise beats, whilst die-cast hoops add exceptional rim shot tones. They also offer superior tension retention during performances.

This marching snare drum is supplied as a complete outfit, including a lightweight marching drum harness and drumsticks.

Olympic Education Percussion

Olympic Education Percussion is a great choice for teachers. This range includes classroom packages – everything you need to teach the basics of percussion and rhythm, as well as xylophones, glockenspiels, marimbas, and hand drums.

Classroom Packages

Classroom packages are a brilliant addition to a primary school classroom as a way of teaching younger children the fundamentals of rhythm and percussion.

These boxes include a mixed selection of small percussion items, covering everything needed to learn the absolute basics.

Plus, the packages are great for encouraging children to work in groups and get creative, making percussive sounds that are fun and interactive.

Hand Drums

Next, as part of the Education range, we have Olympic hand drums. These include headed tambourines, bongo sets, djembes, and congas.

The bongo sets are a brilliant introduction to percussion for beginners of any age. They feature a basswood body, ensuring a durable construction that can withstand the rigors of frequent use. This robust design enables you to play with confidence, whether you are performing on stage or practising in the classroom.

Alternatively, the congas are another great choice for young beginners. With careful attention to detail, these congas have been meticulously crafted to ensure they produce the most authentic sound possible.

The natural heads can be easily tuned to different tensions, allowing for a customised response to suit any playing technique. Whether you prefer a tight and focused sound or a more open and resonant tone, these congas can deliver.

Xylophones

Going one step further, xylophones are a great way to incorporate melodies within rhythm.

The Olympic Padouk Xylophone makes for a fun and useful learning tool in a classroom. It features 37 dark wood bars covering a three-octave span from C5 to C8. Enhanced by aluminium tube resonators, these bars deliver a rich and sustained tone that can ring out within any ensemble. This beautiful clear tone is also perfect for learning the basics of melody.

Glockenspiels

Glockenspiels are very similar to xylophones in terms of their playing techniques.

The main difference, however, is that the tone is slightly higher in pitch due to having metal bars rather than wood. This also tends to make glockenspiels more affordable – perfect for beginners.

The Olympic 32 Note Glockenspiel features 32 carefully tuned bars to achieve accurate pitch on every note.

As well as this, this glockenspiel has a slow decay, making it sing with ease, even in the lower octave.

Whether used in the classroom or to practise on at home, the Olympic 32 Note Glockenspiel is the perfect choice for developing musicians.

Marimbas

Marimbas allow drummers of all abilities to explore new ways of creating rhythm, melody, and harmony, courtesy of their expansive tonal range.

Crafted with precision, the Olympic Practice Marimba features bars made of African Paorosa, renowned for its rich and resonant sound.

The marimba also includes stainless-steel resonators, which enhance the overall resonance and projection of the sound.

Olympic Orchestral Percussion

Olympic Orchestral Percussion is the perfect place for orchestras, community bands, and school music programmes to find the instruments they need. This range includes glockenspiels, marimbas, bass drums, timpanis, chimes, and more.

Glockenspiels

The Olympic Pedal Glockenspiel is designed to be used in large orchestras, and so it has been built to a high professional standard, with great attention to detail. It offers a beautiful sound, full of clear and resonant tones across its 3-octave pitch range, allowing musicians to explore a wide range of melodies and musical styles.

The bars stainless-steel material ensures durability and longevity, making it an excellent choice for professionals.

Marimbas

The Olympic Orchestral Marimba features four octaves, ranging from C3 to C7. It’s suitable for a variety of musical settings, including conservatoires, schools, brass bands, and ensembles.

One of the standout features of the Olympic Padouk Marimba is its superior tone. Hand-tuned from padouk, this instrument delivers a rich and resonant sound that is sure to captivate listeners.

Whether you are performing a solo piece or playing in a group, the marimba’s exceptional tonal quality will shine through.

It’s also practical and convenient to play. With its adjustable height ranging from 850mm to 1070mm, you can find the perfect playing position that suits you comfortably. The sturdy castors then make it easy to transport the marimba from one location to another, allowing you to take your music wherever you go.

Bass Drums

With an impressive size and high-quality construction, concert bass drums deliver a commanding presence and an exceptional sound.

Measuring 36″ x 18″, the Olympic Concert Bass Drum produces deep, resonant tones that add depth and impact to any music composition.

Crafted from basswood, the shell of the drum ensures a warm and rich sound with excellent projection.

The die-cast zinc lugs not only add a touch of elegance to the drum’s appearance but also enhance its tuning stability and overall durability.

Timpanis

Crafted from lightweight fibreglass, the bowl of the Olympic 23″ Timpani provides durability without compromising on sound quality. This fibreglass construction ensures excellent resonance, allowing the instrument to produce a full and balanced sound, whether you’re performing in a small venue or concert hall.

As it’s such a big, commanding instrument, the timpani needs to be stable and ready for powerful hits. The Olympic timpani delivers on that front, stnading up to regular use without sacrificing its superb sound quality.

Featuring tuning markers for C, D, E, F, G, and A, achieving accurate and consistent pitch becomes effortless, paving the way for the creation of beautiful melodies and harmonies.

Chimes

Want to add a touch of elegance and charm to your performance? The Olympic Chrome Chimes are expertly tuned to perfection, producing a mesmerising and harmonious sound.

Tuned to A, 442Hz, these chimes’ tonal clarity is captivating. Whether you’re performing solo or as part of an ensemble, your melodies will ring true and resonate beautifully with your audience.
